data.title: Creating New Atom Launcher Icon In Ubuntu 14.04
data.body:
# Atom Launcher

I installed atom editor from the source , in the ubuntu 14.04 .

The Installation Guide in Github Repository of Atom is quite fun . But I want to create a launcher in desktop . Is there any way to do that . Or are you people thinking of writing it down in installation guide ? please , let me know...

data.title: Multi-character invisibles break editor
data.body:
Upon restarting in 0.204.0 (from 0.201.0; I suspect 0.203.0), everything is screwed up. The tokens appear to be shifted from where they should land, and lines are cut off at the ends. This is happening to all files. After reloading the window, it still occurs.
![broken editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3630663/7875865/cf3e93b4-0590-11e5-9404-645d66e3b62e.png)
Here's a colon that should be highlighted:
![broken editor 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3630663/7875867/d38efeea-0590-11e5-8a11-e848ad7fc591.png)
Here's a gif of me pressing <kbd>Backspace</kbd> <kbd>Backspace</kbd> <kbd>Space</kbd> <kbd>Space</kbd>:
![spspbsbs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3630663/7876021/d6e8a788-0592-11e5-8896-834fda95eb83.gif)
So yeah, I no longer have an editor...

data.body: i 've got a npm error 3 , npm error eacces with the package of localization

data.title: Uncaught Error: Encountered an invalid scope end id. Popped -27, expected to pop -45.
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. I opened it week after I wrote this, and its  crashing when I set syntax highlight to shell
2. file ist just a awk+shell

**Atom Version**: 0.204.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.2
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: Encountered an invalid scope end id. Popped -27, expected to pop -45.

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:573

Error: Encountered an invalid scope end id. Popped -27, expected to pop -45.
  at TokenizedBuffer.module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.scopesFromTags (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:573:21)
  at TokenizedBuffer.module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.openScopesForRow (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:555:21)
  at TokenizedBuffer.module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.tokenizeNextChunk (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:286:105)
  at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:263:26
  at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/underscore-plus/node_modules/underscore/underscore.js:666:47

```
### Commands

```
  3x -0:22.4.0 core:backspace (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -0:04.2.0 application:open (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {},
  "editor": {
    "fontSize": 13,
    "invisibles": {}
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
color-picker, v2.0.2
ide-haskell, v0.5.6
language-glsl, v2.0.0
language-haskell, v1.0.0

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: Distorted Tree View
data.body:
Atom 0.202.0
OS: OS X Yosemite

I have seen this across all versions I have used. It does not show up all the time, just at weird moments.

![screenshot 2015-05-29 09 05 23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/371739/7884326/88b08036-05e2-11e5-9535-bb80e52455c3.png)

Any help on this would be greatly appreciated.

data.title: Feature request : floating tab like chrome
data.body: It would be nice if we could detach and group tabs like we can do in chrome. It will be better if we can manage tabs like in Visual Studio.

data.title: preload pane
data.body:
If I type 'atom', then 'atom dirname', dirname appears in the already open pane almost immediately (unlike the ~1500 ms it takes atom to open a new pane).

Is there a fundamental reason that atom can't, or shouldn't, keep a hidden fully loaded pane in the background, ready for when a user wants to load something into it?

I thought I might try to poke at doing something like this, but I assume there must be a reason it hasn't already been done, or at least attempted? I couldn't find anything.

data.title: Support bazaar as VCS
data.body:
I love your editor guys!
One of the feature I like more is the git support, with highlights of lines/files changed.

Unfortunately, I don't use only git, but also [bazaar](http://bazaar.canonical.com/en/). Could be possible to add a (basic) support for it?

data.title: filename-tabs are flickering
data.body: I am using atom as my standard editor on my MacBook Pro 13, but after some time i noticed that the tabs are flickering! It makes me sometimes a bit nervous.... Maybe you can fix that. Sorry for my bad english, i'm from Germany.

data.title: Add Project Folder when a folder is dropped in the Tree View
data.body: It would be nice to be able to Add Project Folder when a folder is dropped in the Tree View.

data.title: Regex replace with escape \n character only works for first line
data.body:
Using Version 0.201.0 (0.201.0) on OS X Yosemite.

Given this:
![foo bar and baz on separate lines](http://s18.postimg.org/dlrqn01vd/input.png)

When I click 'Replace All' I get this:
![the first line looking correct](http://s23.postimg.org/gstydnv6z/actual.png)

But I expected this:
![all lines looking correct](http://s22.postimg.org/wpvwe7dv5/expected.png)

Not sure if this is a bug or by design. Either way I thought I should raise it.

Cheers,
Matt.

data.title: Soft wrap not work well
data.body:
I checked `Soft Wrap` and `Soft Wrap At Preferred Line Length`，and my line length is 120.
But when I use a small screen ,I can not see the wrap content

data.title: Unnecessary "keep waiting" on startup
data.body:
Version: 0.204.0
OS: OSX 10.10
 Console.app log: 29/5/15 09:23:28.375 Atom[452]: App load time: 15037ms
Installed Packages (all up to date, no errors):
├── language-apache@1.3.0
├── linter@0.12.6
├── minimap@4.9.0
├── script@2.23.0
└── script-runner@1.8.3

Action: start atom (will open previously opened folder)
Expected behaviour: no need for interaction loading
What actually happens:  "Keep waiting?" dialog before a glitched canvas; if "yes" is chosen, the expected behaviour happens instantly, ie the editor and tree view load the most recent project instantly.
![Image of issue](http://i.imgur.com/pgJifLh.png?1)

data.title: Restart and Update not working on OSX
data.body:
Clicking "Restart and Update" from the release notes page or the Atom menu causes Atom to close and fail to restart. Moreover, upon restarting manually, Atom is not updated.

I have tried clearing the ~/.atom/storage directory, as suggested [here](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5692#issuecomment-93859017) but it doesn't solve the problem here.

Platform: OSX 10.10.3, Atom 0.201.0

data.title: Wild memory consuming and 100% CPU usage while editing a small file.
data.body:
It allocates the memory until there's nothing left. No time to terminate.
Platform: Ubuntu 14.04, Mint 17.1, Gnome-shell 3.10.4

data.title: Remove / Collapse Magento project
data.body:
Removing, collapsing a project in particular a magento installation, crashes Atom.

Very strange, now working with a one massive project folder opened, trying to scroll to my other projects heheh.

data.title: Style links and code blocks in text-* classes
data.body:
They were unstyled. So this: 

![screen shot 2015-05-28 at 4 10 06 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/7873204/0fb108d8-0554-11e5-8cd2-743e54f03baa.png)

to this:

![screen shot 2015-05-28 at 4 10 16 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/7873206/12f27c48-0554-11e5-9425-9bd90ba476bb.png)

Maybe should go in the themes, but I wanted this to be in a central place. What do you think @simurai?

data.title: If a keystroke is bound to ‘unset!’, omit it in the application menu
data.body:
Fixes atom/atom-keymap#79

Previously, when keystrokes bound to `unset!` corresponded to commands in the application menu, the commands were getting run anyway due to the operating system's processing of the keyboard shortcut present in the menu. This omits any `unset!` commands from the application menu to prevent that from happening.

This is more general than I would like. If the keystroke is unset in any context, we err on the side of caution and don’t add it to the application menu for any command. Since our application menu isn’t context aware, this should be good enough for now and solve the 80% case. Someday we should make the application menu update / gray out options when the focused element changes. Only then would we be able to precisely determine that a binding was unset in a given context, because we would have an element. Without an element it's just guess-work because who knows when a selector will match.

data.title: Skip linting for benchmark fixtures
data.body: We shouldn't accidentally lint benchmark fixtures either.

data.title: "Add Project Folder…" menu item does nothing if no window is open
data.body:
I am using Atom Version 0.204.0 (0.204.0) on OS X 10.10.3.

If there isn't a window open but you select "Add Project Folder…" from the "File" menu nothing happens.

The expected behavior would be for a file selection dialog box to appear and then to have a new window open with the selected folder added as a project.

(Alternatively, the menu item could be greyed out I suppose but having it operational would match the behavior of the "Open…" menu item.

data.title: Settings button after package update not working
data.body:
When updating one or more packages the "Settings" button won't work anymore.
I came across this issue some time ago when i wanted to read the changelog of the updated package, so i can't really say in which version i first experienced this.
Actually using `0.200.0`, also tried in `--safe` mode, same result.

It's a bit difficult to reproduce the issue as you need updateable package, so here's a anim do demonstrate:
![screencast](http://i.imgur.com/C3gnmLe.gif)

data.title: Blue squirrel still shows after updates until second restart
data.body:
After installing an Atom update and restarting, the blue squirrel stays present until I restart again. If you have OCPD or FOMO it's hard to ignore that squirrel, but also annoying to re-open all the windows/files as they were.

It'd be great if installing an update hid him immediately.

Sorry if this is the wrong repo to create the issue. I didn't see a sub-package that seemed responsible for handling updates.

data.title: Closing code blocks within an open file is buggy
data.body:
OS: Ubuntu 14.10
Atom: 0.198.0

I have no better way to describe this, sorry. If I have 3 nested code blocks and I try to close just the 3rd nested block, it closes the main block. If I open the main block I'll find the third block closed. It's an annoying little thing, but this makes it so I have to close/open things two times just to get the view I want.

Example, trying to close the list item at L37: 
![atom-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6880594/7867104/d36ae0cc-0528-11e5-86fa-2cfa613e4864.png)

After closing list item at L37:
![atom-2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6880594/7867108/ddd64aa6-0528-11e5-84e5-5fea78858775.png)

data.title: Cannot click and drag anything
data.body:
Hi,  I recently opened an issue here atom/tabs#148 , claiming I couldn't drag tabs around to rearrange them, but realized it's a more general problem.  I can't left-click and drag ANYTHING in Atom.  I can't even left mouse down and drag to highlight text.  It's as if the mouse up event is firing when it shouldn't.

I'm using a fresh install of 
Atom 0.204.0
on Linux Mint 17 Qiana (based on Ubuntu 14.04, Trusty Tahr)

Thanks!

data.title: unset! not working anymore (0.202.0), impossible to type curly braces!!
data.body:
Atom is the first code editor in the world that prevent me typing curly braces b/c of a default key binding! So I had to search around and I found that I had to prevent that binding with: 
   `'ctrl-alt-[': 'unset!'` and `'ctrl-alt-]': 'unset!'` in the file: _keymap.cson_.

But that's broken in the latest version... that makes Atom useless, for me at least!

data.title: atom CLI now opens empty atom window
data.body: Previously if you were at the terminal and typed "atom" it opened the current directory in atom. As of a recent release, it now opens an empty window. To achieve the same result as before one must now type "atom .". I understand making changes and that relearning will be required, but it does seem like consistency across github CLI's should be important. GitHub for Mac opens the current directory if you simply type "github". This means one github product requires "." for the current directory and another does not. Now I'm left in a state of never getting it right for either of them. :)

data.title: Use lsb virtual package instead of hard require
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6983
Refs https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/6888

I'm not 100% sure, but I think this should fix https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6983 – rather than requiring the exact package name (which may be repo-specific) this requires the virtual package name `lsb`, which should cover all possible `lsb` packages for distros. 

I've tested this on Fedora 21, but don't have a VM set up for any other RPM-based distros. If anyone does, I'd very much appreciate trying to install `lsb` with your package manager and reporting your results here. Thanks!

/cc @kevinsawicki @mingjunyang

data.title: Use previous definition of scope selector match to fix API breakage
Add a rootDirectories filtering option to atom.workspace.scan().
data.body:
By default, `atom.workspace.scan()` scans everything in `atom.project.getDirectories()`.
This introduces the option to restrict `scan()` to a specific set of `Directory` objects.

This will be useful for excluding special root `Directory` objects (such as those created
via a custom `DirectoryProvider`) from calls to `scan()`, if appropriate.

Because I was in the neighborhood, I also made some small documentation fixes:
- Documented the previously undocumented `onPathsSearched` option.
- Clarified that the returned `Promise` has a `cancel()` method.
